revised_title: Determination of the Difference in the Number of Vibrations Made by an Invariable Pendulum in the Royal Observatory and in London
tldr: Captain Edward Sabine conducted experiments to determine the difference in the number of vibrations made by an invariable pendulum at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich and a house in London. The results showed a diurnal acceleration of 0.57 to 0.52 vibrations, indicating a discrepancy between theory and experiment.
